intro: Sterculia comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian sterculia, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros archipelago. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are large, palmately lobed, and often have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
